annotation:
The foods served at this particular banquet would be considered unusual since they constitute everyday fare and not particularly exciting everyday fare at that. In this case, the poor food makes the celebration memorable. 

      Kirsten Marie had previously told a story about another banquet that was memorable, in that case because the hosts should not have been able to afford such an elaborate celebration (KMP 2.07). In both cases, she emphasizes the violation of expectations.

     In the published version, Tang Kristensen separated these descriptions and, in so doing, erased the continuity of the descriptions and the clear sense of expectations for banquets.
danish_manuscript:
Til et stort Barselgilde
fik de ikke andet end Velling (Boghvede)
og Fisk det første a kan huske.
english_manuscript: At one big birth celebration, they weren't served anything but (buckwheat) gruel and fish as far as I can remember.
danish_publication: Til et stort barselgilde fik de ikke andet end vælling (boghvede-) og fisk det förste a kan huske.
english_publication: At one big birth celebration, they weren’t served anything but (buckwheat) gruel and fish as far as I can remember.
